required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Electronic Health Record-Enabled Evidence-Based Smoking Cessation Quality Improvement Implementation Program
clinical_study.official_title: Electronic Health Record-Enabled Evidence-based Smoking Cessation Quality Improvement Program

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this quality improvement program is to implement, evaluate, and sustain an evidence-based smoking cessation treatment program with a population-based approach so that all patients at the Siteman Cancer Center, Washington University, Barnes-Jewish Hospital, BJC Healthcare, and satellite locations receive assessment of smoking and all smokers receive treatment support.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinic level percentage of patients receiving brief counseling
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 6 months pre-intervention through 6 months post-intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Clinic level percentage of smokers offered referral to additional counseling
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 6 months pre-intervention through 6 months post-intervention

primary_outcome.measure: Clinic level percentage of smokers offered medication
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 6 months pre-intervention through 6 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinic level percentage of patients receiving brief counseling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Estimated to be 12 months pre-intervention and 12, 24, 36, and 48 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinic level percentage of smokers offered referral to additional counseling
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Estimated to be 12 months pre-intervention and 12, 24, 36, and 48 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinic level percentage of smokers offered medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Estimated to be 12 months pre-intervention and 12, 24, 36, and 48 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinic level percentage of smokers receiving smoking assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Estimated to be 12 months pre-intervention and 12, 24, 36, and 48 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinic level percentage of smokers receiving cessation medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Estimated to be 12 months pre-intervention and 12, 24, 36, and 48 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who have abstained from smoking

arm_group.description: Patients enter the program through clinic appointments or community outreach programs. Patients will be given brief advice to quit smoking and referral options to receive evidence-based treatment through Missouri/Illinois Quitlines, Smokefree.TXT, or smokefree.gov dependent on the patient's preference for counseling Patient can also be prescribed smoking cessation pharmacotherapy

intervention.intervention_name: ELEVATE enhancement to electronic health record (EHR) to improve cessation counseling offer
intervention.description: Brief advise to quit smoking Referral to Missouri/Illinois Quitlines, Smokefree.TXT, or smokefree.gov

intervention.intervention_name: ELEVATE enhancement to electronic health record (EHR) to improve smoking cessation medication offer
intervention.description: -Nicotine replacement therapy, varenicline, bupropion, or combination therapy (not provided by study)
-Feedback reports will be based on data

study_pop.textblock: Patients 18 years of age or older

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Patients seen at Siteman Cancer Center, Washington University, Barnes-Jewish Hospital, BJC Healthcare, or any of the satellite locations
Exclusion Criteria:
-None

link.description: Alvin J. Siteman Cancer Center at Barnes-Jewish Hospital and Washington University School of Medicine
